title: Why is the training time on pointer-generator with the same hyperparameters 4 times the original paper (https://arxiv.org/abs/1704.04368) ?
body:
I run this code with the same hyperparameters of https://arxiv.org/abs/1704.04368, however, the training time is about 15 days (4 days and 14 hours in original paper).
a. single Tesla K40m GPU with batch size of 16
b. hyperparameters: 
mode	train
exp_name	pointer-generator
log_root	./log/pointer-generator
single_pass	False
beam_size	4
decode_from	train
decode_after	0
batch_queue_threads	2
example_queue_threads	4
bucketing_cache_size	100
gpu_num	0
debug	False
restore_best_model	False
enc_hidden_dim	256
dec_hidden_dim	256
emb_dim	128
vocab_size	50000
lr	0.15
adagrad_init_acc	0.1
rand_unif_init_mag	0.02
trunc_norm_init_std	0.0001
embedding	None
max_grad_norm	2.0
max_enc_steps	400
max_dec_steps	100
min_dec_steps	35
batch_size	16
max_iter	600000
pointer_gen	True
convert_to_coverage_model	False
coverage	False
cov_loss_wt	1.0
intradecoder	False
use_temporal_attention	False
matrix_attention	False
share_decoder_weights	False
avoid_trigrams	True
rl_training	False
self_critic	True
fixed_eta	False
eta	0
reward_function	rouge_l/f_score
convert_to_reinforce_model	False
use_discounted_rewards	False
gamma	0.99
use_intermediate_rewards	False
scheduled_sampling	False
scheduled_sampling_final_dist	True
sampling_probability	0
fixed_sampling_probability	False
hard_argmax	True
greedy_scheduled_sampling	False
E2EBackProp	False
alpha	1
decay_function	linear
ac_training	False
dqn_scheduled_sampling	False
dqn_layers	512,256,128
dqn_replay_buffer_size	100000
dqn_batch_size	100
dqn_target_update	10000
dqn_sleep_time	2
dqn_gpu_num	0
dueling_net	True
dqn_polyak_averaging	True
calculate_true_q	False
dqn_pretrain	False
dqn_pretrain_steps	10000
k	1
